section.title: How the nova client works
section.para: The nova client is an open-source Python client that let you run commands to make API calls. The client is easy to learn and use. Each client command runs cURL commands that embed API requests. You can run the client from a desktop machine or remote system, such as a Cloud Server.
To install the nova client on a Linux distribution or on Mac OS X, see “(Optional) Install the nova client with the Cloud Networks extension”.
To configure the client, update your bash profile to set and export environment variables.

note.para: You can specify a debug parameter on any nova command to show the underlying API request for the command. This is a good way to become familiar with the API requests.

warning.para: If you upgrade the operating system of the desktop or remote machine where you installed them, you may need to reinstall the nova client.
